filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Hello, this is 6 Minute English from BBC Learning English. I'm Neil.And I'm Georgie.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Focaccia. Where would I be then?Focaccia and mozzarella. Well, you'd be in Italy, right?Yes, Italy, or Little Italy to be exact. The neighbourhood in some cities where Italian communities settled and made their home.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: But before that, I have a question for you, Georgie. I think it must be pizza.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json
RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Italy, from Genoa, from Liguria. He was born in the centre of Genoa and arrived here in 1898 at the age of seven and a half. And this pizzeria where we are was founded on March 28, 1932. We have been here for 91 years.So what culinary traditions did they bring with them?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: The culinary tradition is pizzeria and we incorporated the faina from Genoa, which is a pizza with chickpea flour.In 1898, Giuseppe founded his pizzeria, a restaurant selling pizza. When a business is founded, it's established. Someone starts it up or sets it up.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: The adjective culinary describes anything connected with cooking.But probably the best known Little Italy in the world is an area of Manhattan's Lower East Side in New York.90% of Italian immigrants who arrived in the US at the turn of the century came through this neighbourhood.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: The owner of Salvino explains more about his family history to BBC World Service programme The Food Chain
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: L'Italie is the stepping stone of the Italian immigrant.This is where many of the Italians first came through Ellis Island and then settled here and then eventually moved into mainstream America throughout the rest of the country.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: After arriving in New York, many Italian immigrants moved on to start successful new lives elsewhere.That's why Lou calls Little Italy a stepping stone, an experience that helps you achieve something else, like a real stepping stone helps you cross a river.As a result, Italian newcomers became accepted in mainstream America.Mainstream meaning the culture and customs viewed as normal by most Americans.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: But we still don't know which food is most popular
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: in pizza.If something is founded, it's started or established.The adjective culinary describes anything connected with cooking.Phrases like fourth or fifth generation describe the children of people whose parents immigrated to a particular country.A stepping stone is an event or experience that helps you advance or achieve something new.And finally, the adjective mainstream describes the customs and culture which are accepted as normal by most people in a society.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Once again, our Six Minutes are up.Until the next time here at Six Minute English, it's ciao!Ciao!
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_What and where is Little Italy_.json
